item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 9, 2025 at 5:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. It is as if you were on your phone (141 points | 16 comments)
2. Improving on std:count_if()'s auto-vectorization (56 points | 12 comments)
3. Mako: An extremely fast, production-grade web bundler based on Rust by Ant Group (24 points | 6 comments)
4. US Ends Support For Ukrainian F-16s (582 points | 967 comments)
5. How do you process the news? (37 points | 22 comments)
6. Infisical (YC W23) Is Hiring for Full Stack Engineers in San Francisco ( | hide)
7. My 16-month theanine self-experiment (579 points | 314 comments)
8. PurrCrypt: Steganographic Encryption Disguised as Pet Sounds (18 points | 2 comments)
9. 16-Bit to 1-Bit: Visual KV Cache Quantization for Efficient Multimodal LLMs (34 points | discuss)
10. Reasons veterans are especially hard-hit by federal cuts (12 points | 2 comments)
11. Show HN: C++ AWS MSK IAM Auth Implementation – Goodbye Kafka Passwords (25 points | discuss)
12. Goravel: A Go framework inspired by Laravel (102 points | 76 comments)
13. Gleam v1.9.0 Released (122 points | 21 comments)
14. AI tools are spotting errors in research papers (547 points | 197 comments)
15. Why Layoffs Don't Work (165 points | 205 comments)
16. Online Embedded Rust Simulator (89 points | 11 comments)
17. Presenterm: Markdown Slideshows in the Terminal (249 points | 38 comments)
18. Building an open-source Wi-Fi Mac layer for the ESP32 (137 points | 18 comments)
19. Orange Pi RV2 is a single-board PC with an 8-core RISC-V processor (20 points | 3 comments)
20. Show HN: I built an app to get daily wisdom from Mr. Worldwide (270 points | 69 comments)
21. The DOJ still wants Google to sell off Chrome (413 points | 588 comments)
22. LFortran Compiles Prima (51 points | 12 comments)
23. Stem cell therapy trial reverses "irreversible" damage to cornea (167 points | 27 comments)
24. "Big 3" science fiction magazines including Asimov's and Analog acquired (131 points | 75 comments)
25. I've been using Claude Code for a couple of days (116 points | 152 comments)
26. H3: For indexing geographies into a hexagonal grid, by Uber (81 points | 31 comments)
27. Commodore 64 PETSCII Image (2022) (45 points | 8 comments)
28. Discovering errors in Donald Knuth's TAOCP (188 points | 54 comments)
29. Discworld Rules (249 points | 287 comments)
30. Roald Dahl on the death of his daughter (2015) (152 points | 55 comments)
